history.text: So we both saw Maleficent.  What did you think about it?
It was charming but a bit bland. Angelina looked amazing as Maleficent. Did you like it?
I thought it was entertaining.  Did you like Elle Fanning as Aurora?
I did. I usually don't watch movies with a 50% rating but it was generally entertaining. Do you normally enjoy fantasy films?
I do, and I enjoyed this one.  I thought it was cool how they told the story from Maleficent's perspective.
It really was an interesting spin on Sleeping Beauty. It really brought life and depth to Maleficent as a character. Do you agree with the critic ratings?
No, I think it should have been rated higher.  It was an interesting story with cool visuals.
But CinemaScore gave it an A, and I agree with that.
The scenery was very colorful and whimsical which I enjoyed. I do think the movie deserves at least 70%.
Robert Stromberg did a great job directing, right?
He really made it something new and exciting.
He did. Walt Disney's Sleeping Beauty is tried and true but I liked how unique Maleficent was.
Me too.  It's interesting how Maleficent was in love with a human, initially.
Unsurprisingly, he betrays her for his own gain. What did you think of Stefan when he decided not to kill her?
I think it was sad, because he may as well have killed her when he cut off her wings.  He used iron, which he knew would hurt her.  He is no better than if he killed her.
Yeah, his character annoyed me. I really liked Dival though. His shape-shifting was pretty cool.
Definitely.  I'm glad Maleficent got a companion.
What I don't get though, is if she has the power to transform humans and animals into different forms, why didn't she transform herself back into a winged fairy?
I guess it's the iron and magical fairytale mumbo jumbo.
Hmm maybe.  That's funny that Aurora thinks Maleficent is her fairy godmother when she's actually trying to kill her.
It's cute that Maleficent took care of Aurora and watched over her, though with initial reluctance.
True.  She wanted to remove the curse but couldn't.

Yep, she needs a true love's kiss. The fairies were pretty incompetent but that definitely drove some major plot points since Maleficent probably wouldn't have started caring for Aurora if they weren't neglectful.
True, I'm glad she found out the truth about her dad though.

Yep. Aurora's encounter with Prince Philip was cute. I
 guess it's not a fairytale with no hetero-romantic subplot.
I like that they kept the spinning wheel in the curse.
Yep it was a nice touch. I like that the movie's main focus was on maternal love instead of romantic love.
Me too.  It was a cute twist.  I'm glad she killed Stefan too.  He was the worst.
Exactly. 'Not being able to bring themselves to kill the other' had negative consequences for Stefan and almost did for Maleficent too.
I'm glad Aurora felt the same way about Maleficent though
The forehead kiss was so precious. It seemed fitting that Aurora finds Maleficent's wings.
Definitely.
I thought I had to send 5 messages.
